thread.title: Chain of Fails: These Dawgs Ain't Got No Soul
thread.title_full: Chain of Fails: These Dawgs Ain't Got No Soul

author: Cherokee's Grip
title: Chain of Fails: These Dawgs Ain't Got No Soul
text:
In the second half open comment thread, the following comment made a particular song start playing in my head: 
Devastating blow, but 
there was a LOOOONG chain of fail before we even got there. 
- A small body of determined spirits fired by an unquenchable faith in their mission can alter the course of history. by CIA Chef Dawg on Oct 10, 2015 | 7:37 PM up reply rec flag 
That was posted in response to another commenter blaming the Davis drop for the loss, and CIA Chef Dawg's pointing out the "chain of fail" (or "synergy of suck" as we've called it in the past) hit the nail on the head. The past 2 weeks have been one long chain of fails, and I have no optimism that things will improve anytime soon. Not that I ever really expect things to improve in general; I'm just not that kind of person. 
I could go on and on about the frustration of watching good players do bad things at the worst times, the inability of our O-line to consistently open up the running game, our QB's inability to throw accurate passes in a timely manner, Schotty's shoddy play-calling these past few weeks, our secondary's inability to get off the field on 3rd or 4th down, our kickoff/punt returners' inability to avoid at least one muff a game, and...where was I? Oh, right. I could go on and on, but I'm not going to. 
I've gotten out of the habit of offering apologies to the people whose works I've parodied because A) many of them are already dead anyway and B) I'm not actually sorry. But Aretha Franklin has way more soul than the Dawgs I've watched the past couple of weeks and is (fortunately) still alive, so I whole-heartedly apologize for this parody. Not enough to not post it, but I figured I'd at least make the gesture. So with apologies to Aretha Franklin: 
Original Version:
